projects.title: Insurance Application
projects.description: The project involved developing an Insurance Application, integrating a Spring Boot backend and JavaFX and React Native frontends. Security measures like OWASP ZAP and SonarLint scans were implemented to prevent vulnerabilities. JWT was utilized for secure and efficient user authentication. The server was dockerized

projects.title: Car Damages Detection
projects.description: The project focused on semantic segmentation for vehicle damage detection. Using a dataset from Roboflow and various metrics, it enabled the training and testing of both state-of-the-art and custom architectures.

projects.title: Universitary Events
projects.description: A social media platform for events, built with Express.js and vanilla JavaScript on the frontend. It features authentication and authorization with two distinct user roles. Users can create and manage their own events, register for others, and enjoy a variety of additional features.

projects.title: Llama ChatBot
projects.description: This project is a full-stack web application that combines a Spring Boot backend with a Next.js frontend, designed to facilitate chatbot interactions. The chatbot provides real-time information such as currency exchange rates and weather updates for cities worldwide.

projects.title: Cryptographic Chat
projects.description: This project addresses the need for a secure, end-to-end system where only users involved in a conversation can access the content of their chats. Neither the server nor potential attackers can decipher the communication. The objective is to uphold the five pillars of CIANA, as defined by NIST: Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability, Authentication, and Non-repudiation.

projects.title: Ecommerce App
projects.description: This e-commerce app is built in Kotlin, allowing users to log in, create a wishlist, and browse products fetched from a public API. The backend database is managed using Firebase.

projects.title: Algoritmic Techniques
projects.description: A collection of algorithms covering various paradigms, including graph algorithms (Kruskal, Dijkstra), greedy methods, dynamic programming, backtracking, and divide-and-conquer techniques.

projects.title: DevOps Notes
projects.description: A collection of notes and resources for DevOps exam preparation, covering Kubernetes, Docker, and application deployment. Includes detailed labs, troubleshooting tips, and practical insights to strengthen understanding of containerization and Kubernetes management.
